task: Concatenate all .MF4 files in the input_folder and save in the output_folder with specified output_filename. (Parameters: input_folder=C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Kia EV6\LOG\2F6913DB\00001026, output_folder=C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Kia EV6\LOG\2F6913DB\00001026, output_filename=Kia_EV_6_2F6913DB.mf4)

plan.reasoning: Activate the asammdf application before any UI interactions
Capture current UI elements to locate menus and controls
Open the Mode menu to switch to Batch processing (from KB: set_mode_batch_processing)
Capture the Mode submenu UI (KB learning: must re-run State-Tool after opening Mode to get sub-item coordinates)
Select Batch processing mode (from KB: set_mode_batch_processing)
Capture Batch processing view so batch controls are discoverable
Use File → Open to add multiple files into the batch (use open_files KB because Add files button often isn't present/fails)
Capture the File menu options to locate Open
Open the file selection dialog to load files (from KB: open_files)
Capture the file-open dialog elements (filename edit, file list, Open button) before interacting
Focus the File name edit so we can navigate to the input folder (from KB: open_files)
Enter the exact input folder path and press Enter to navigate into it (KB recommends entering folder path first to ensure correct selection)
Allow the file dialog to navigate and populate the file list
Re-capture dialog to obtain file list entries now that the folder is loaded
Select any one .MF4 file in the folder so we can then select all (recommended in KB: open_files)
Select all .MF4 files in the folder once one file is selected (from KB: open_files; avoids missing files)
Press Enter to confirm and open all selected files (KB learning: pressing Enter is more reliable than clicking Open)
Capture Batch processing file list to confirm files were loaded into the batch UI
Select the Concatenate operation for the loaded files (from KB: batch_concatenate_files). If multiple Concatenate buttons exist, use the one in the batch operations area (KB learning).
Capture the concatenation options and output filename field to prepare saving
Focus the output File name edit to enter the destination path (from KB: batch_concatenate_files)
Enter the full output path (folder + filename) where the concatenated MF4 will be saved (from KB: batch_concatenate_files). Use placeholders from task parameters.
Click Save to start the concatenation/export process (KB learning: Save is the correct final action, not Start)
Capture any progress UI or confirmation after initiating Save to monitor completion
Wait briefly for concatenation to start and for UI to update; adjust if files are large
Final capture to verify the operation completed or to detect any errors/messages

Switch to Batch processing, add all .MF4 files from the specified input folder using File→Open (select one file then Ctrl+A to reliably select all), choose the Concatenate operation, enter the output folder+filename, and click Save to perform the concatenation. State-Tool calls are placed before every UI interaction to obtain reliable coordinates as required by the environment and based on KB learnings.

metadata.operation: Concatenate all .MF4 files in the input_folder and save in the output_folder with specified output_filename.
